00070 /* Set the given animation-channel as the active one for the active context */
00071 // TODO: extend for animdata types...
00072 void ANIM_set_active_channel (bAnimContext *ac, void *data, short datatype, int filter, void *channel_data, short channel_type)
00073 {
00074     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
00075     bAnimListElem *ale;
00076     
00077     /* try to build list of filtered items */
00078     ANIM_animdata_filter(ac, &anim_data, filter, data, datatype);
00079     if (anim_data.first == NULL)
00080         return;
00081         
00082     /* only clear the 'active' flag for the channels of the same type */
00083     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
00084         /* skip if types don't match */
00085         if (channel_type != ale->type)
00086             continue;
00087         
00088         /* flag to set depends on type */
00089         switch (ale->type) {
00090             case ANIMTYPE_GROUP:
00091             {
00092                 bActionGroup *agrp= (bActionGroup *)ale->data;
00093                 
00094                 ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(agrp, ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR, AGRP_ACTIVE);
00095             }
00096                 break;
00097             case ANIMTYPE_FCURVE:
00098             {
00099                 FCurve *fcu= (FCurve *)ale->data;
00100                 
00101                 ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(fcu, ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR, FCURVE_ACTIVE);
00102             }
00103                 break;
00104             case ANIMTYPE_NLATRACK:
00105             {
00106                 NlaTrack *nlt= (NlaTrack *)ale->data;
00107                 
00108                 ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(nlt, ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR, NLATRACK_ACTIVE);
00109             }
00110                 break;
00111             
00112             case ANIMTYPE_FILLACTD: /* Action Expander */
00113             case ANIMTYPE_DSMAT:    /* Datablock AnimData Expanders */
00114             case ANIMTYPE_DSLAM:
00115             case ANIMTYPE_DSCAM:
00116             case ANIMTYPE_DSCUR:
00117             case ANIMTYPE_DSSKEY:
00118             case ANIMTYPE_DSWOR:
00119             case ANIMTYPE_DSPART:
00120             case ANIMTYPE_DSMBALL:
00121             case ANIMTYPE_DSARM:
00122             case ANIMTYPE_DSMESH:
00123             case ANIMTYPE_DSTEX:
00124             case ANIMTYPE_DSLAT:
00125             case ANIMTYPE_DSSPK:
00126             {
00127                 /* need to verify that this data is valid for now */
00128                 if (ale->adt) {
00129                     ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(ale->adt, ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR, ADT_UI_ACTIVE);
00130                 }
00131             }
00132                 break;
00133         }
00134     }
00135     
00136     /* set active flag */
00137     if (channel_data) {
00138         switch (channel_type) {
00139             case ANIMTYPE_GROUP:
00140             {
00141                 bActionGroup *agrp= (bActionGroup *)channel_data;
00142                 agrp->flag |= AGRP_ACTIVE;
00143             }
00144                 break;
00145             case ANIMTYPE_FCURVE:
00146             {
00147                 FCurve *fcu= (FCurve *)channel_data;
00148                 fcu->flag |= FCURVE_ACTIVE;
00149             }
00150                 break;
00151             case ANIMTYPE_NLATRACK:
00152             {
00153                 NlaTrack *nlt= (NlaTrack *)channel_data;
00154                 nlt->flag |= NLATRACK_ACTIVE;
00155             }
00156                 break;
00157                 
00158             case ANIMTYPE_FILLACTD: /* Action Expander */
00159             case ANIMTYPE_DSMAT:    /* Datablock AnimData Expanders */
00160             case ANIMTYPE_DSLAM:
00161             case ANIMTYPE_DSCAM:
00162             case ANIMTYPE_DSCUR:
00163             case ANIMTYPE_DSSKEY:
00164             case ANIMTYPE_DSWOR:
00165             case ANIMTYPE_DSPART:
00166             case ANIMTYPE_DSMBALL:
00167             case ANIMTYPE_DSARM:
00168             case ANIMTYPE_DSMESH:
00169             case ANIMTYPE_DSLAT:
00170             case ANIMTYPE_DSSPK:
00171             {
00172                 /* need to verify that this data is valid for now */
00173                 if (ale && ale->adt) {
00174                     ale->adt->flag |= ADT_UI_ACTIVE;
00175                 }
00176             }
00177                 break;
00178         }
00179     }
00180     
00181     /* clean up */
00182     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
00183 }
00184 
00185 /* Deselect all animation channels 
00186  *  - data: pointer to datatype, as contained in bAnimContext
00187  *  - datatype: the type of data that 'data' represents (eAnimCont_Types)
00188  *  - test: check if deselecting instead of selecting
00189  *  - sel: eAnimChannels_SetFlag;
00190  */
00191 void ANIM_deselect_anim_channels (bAnimContext *ac, void *data, short datatype, short test, short sel)
00192 {
00193     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
00194     bAnimListElem *ale;
00195     int filter;
00196     
00197     /* filter data */
00198     /* NOTE: no list visible, otherwise, we get dangling */
00199     filter= ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_CHANNELS;
00200     ANIM_animdata_filter(ac, &anim_data, filter, data, datatype);
00201     
00202     /* See if we should be selecting or deselecting */
00203     if (test) {
00204         for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
00205             if (sel == 0) 
00206                 break;
00207             
00208             switch (ale->type) {
00209                 case ANIMTYPE_SCENE:
00210                     if (ale->flag & SCE_DS_SELECTED)
00211                         sel= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR;
00212                     break;
00213                 case ANIMTYPE_OBJECT:
00214                 #if 0   /* for now, do not take object selection into account, since it gets too annoying */
00215                     if (ale->flag & SELECT)
00216                         sel= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR;
00217                 #endif
00218                     break;
00219                 case ANIMTYPE_GROUP:
00220                     if (ale->flag & AGRP_SELECTED)
00221                         sel= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR;
00222                     break;
00223                 case ANIMTYPE_FCURVE:
00224                     if (ale->flag & FCURVE_SELECTED)
00225                         sel= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR;
00226                     break;
00227                 case ANIMTYPE_SHAPEKEY:
00228                     if (ale->flag & KEYBLOCK_SEL)
00229                         sel= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR;
00230                     break;
00231                 case ANIMTYPE_NLATRACK:
00232                     if (ale->flag & NLATRACK_SELECTED)
00233                         sel= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR;
00234                     break;
00235                     
00236                 case ANIMTYPE_FILLACTD: /* Action Expander */
00237                 case ANIMTYPE_DSMAT:    /* Datablock AnimData Expanders */
00238                 case ANIMTYPE_DSLAM:
00239                 case ANIMTYPE_DSCAM:
00240                 case ANIMTYPE_DSCUR:
00241                 case ANIMTYPE_DSSKEY:
00242                 case ANIMTYPE_DSWOR:
00243                 case ANIMTYPE_DSPART:
00244                 case ANIMTYPE_DSMBALL:
00245                 case ANIMTYPE_DSARM:
00246                 case ANIMTYPE_DSMESH:
00247                 case ANIMTYPE_DSNTREE:
00248                 case ANIMTYPE_DSTEX:
00249                 case ANIMTYPE_DSLAT:
00250                 case ANIMTYPE_DSSPK:
00251                 {
00252                     if ((ale->adt) && (ale->adt->flag & ADT_UI_SELECTED))
00253                         sel= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR;
00254                 }
00255                     break;
00256                     
00257                 case ANIMTYPE_GPLAYER:
00258                     if (ale->flag & GP_LAYER_SELECT)
00259                         sel= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR;
00260                     break;
00261             }
00262         }
00263     }
00264         
00265     /* Now set the flags */
00266     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
00267         switch (ale->type) {
00268             case ANIMTYPE_SCENE:
00269             {
00270                 Scene *scene= (Scene *)ale->data;
00271                 
00272                 ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(scene, sel, SCE_DS_SELECTED);
00273                 
00274                 if (scene->adt) {
00275                     ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(scene, sel, ADT_UI_SELECTED);
00276                 }
00277             }
00278                 break;
00279             case ANIMTYPE_OBJECT:
00280             #if 0   /* for now, do not take object selection into account, since it gets too annoying */
00281             {
00282                 Base *base= (Base *)ale->data;
00283                 Object *ob= base->object;
00284                 
00285                 ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(base, sel, SELECT);
00286                 ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(ob, sel, SELECT);
00287                 
00288                 if (ob->adt) {
00289                     ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(ob, sel, ADT_UI_SELECTED);
00290                 }
00291             }
00292             #endif
00293                 break;
00294             case ANIMTYPE_GROUP:
00295             {
00296                 bActionGroup *agrp= (bActionGroup *)ale->data;
00297                 
00298                 ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(agrp, sel, AGRP_SELECTED);
00299                 agrp->flag &= ~AGRP_ACTIVE;
00300             }
00301                 break;
00302             case ANIMTYPE_FCURVE:
00303             {
00304                 FCurve *fcu= (FCurve *)ale->data;
00305                 
00306                 ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(fcu, sel, FCURVE_SELECTED);
00307                 fcu->flag &= ~FCURVE_ACTIVE;
00308             }
00309                 break;
00310             case ANIMTYPE_SHAPEKEY:
00311             {
00312                 KeyBlock *kb= (KeyBlock *)ale->data;
00313                 
00314                 ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(kb, sel, KEYBLOCK_SEL);
00315             }
00316                 break;
00317             case ANIMTYPE_NLATRACK:
00318             {
00319                 NlaTrack *nlt= (NlaTrack *)ale->data;
00320                 
00321                 ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(nlt, sel, NLATRACK_SELECTED);
00322                 nlt->flag &= ~NLATRACK_ACTIVE;
00323             }
00324                 break;
00325                 
00326             case ANIMTYPE_FILLACTD: /* Action Expander */
00327             case ANIMTYPE_DSMAT:    /* Datablock AnimData Expanders */
00328             case ANIMTYPE_DSLAM:
00329             case ANIMTYPE_DSCAM:
00330             case ANIMTYPE_DSCUR:
00331             case ANIMTYPE_DSSKEY:
00332             case ANIMTYPE_DSWOR:
00333             case ANIMTYPE_DSPART:
00334             case ANIMTYPE_DSMBALL:
00335             case ANIMTYPE_DSARM:
00336             case ANIMTYPE_DSMESH:
00337             case ANIMTYPE_DSNTREE:
00338             case ANIMTYPE_DSTEX:
00339             case ANIMTYPE_DSLAT:
00340             case ANIMTYPE_DSSPK:
00341             {
00342                 /* need to verify that this data is valid for now */
00343                 if (ale->adt) {
00344                     ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(ale->adt, sel, ADT_UI_SELECTED);
00345                     ale->adt->flag &= ~ADT_UI_ACTIVE;
00346                 }
00347             }
00348                 break;
00349                 
00350             case ANIMTYPE_GPLAYER:
00351             {
00352                 bGPDlayer *gpl = (bGPDlayer *)ale->data;
00353                 
00354                 ACHANNEL_SET_FLAG(gpl, sel, GP_LAYER_SELECT);
00355             }
00356                 break;
00357         }
00358     }
00359     
00360     /* Cleanup */
00361     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
00362 }

00364 /* ---------------------------- Graph Editor ------------------------------------- */
00365 
00366 /* Flush visibility (for Graph Editor) changes up/down hierarchy for changes in the given setting 
00367  *  - anim_data: list of the all the anim channels that can be chosen
00368  *      -> filtered using ANIMFILTER_CHANNELS only, since if we took VISIBLE too,
00369  *        then the channels under closed expanders get ignored...
00370  *  - ale_setting: the anim channel (not in the anim_data list directly, though occurring there)
00371  *      with the new state of the setting that we want flushed up/down the hierarchy 
00372  *  - setting: type of setting to set
00373  *  - on: whether the visibility setting has been enabled or disabled 
00374  */
00375 void ANIM_flush_setting_anim_channels (bAnimContext *ac, ListBase *anim_data, bAnimListElem *ale_setting, int setting, short on)
00376 {
00377     bAnimListElem *ale, *match=NULL;
00378     int prevLevel=0, matchLevel=0;
00379     
00380     /* sanity check */
00381     if (ELEM(NULL, anim_data, anim_data->first))
00382         return;
00383     
00384     /* find the channel that got changed */
00385     for (ale= anim_data->first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
00386         /* compare data, and type as main way of identifying the channel */
00387         if ((ale->data == ale_setting->data) && (ale->type == ale_setting->type)) {
00388             /* we also have to check the ID, this is assigned to, since a block may have multiple users */
00389             // TODO: is the owner-data more revealing?
00390             if (ale->id == ale_setting->id) {
00391                 match= ale;
00392                 break;
00393             }
00394         }
00395     }
00396     if (match == NULL) {
00397         printf("ERROR: no channel matching the one changed was found\n");
00398         return;
00399     }
00400     else {
00401         bAnimChannelType *acf= ANIM_channel_get_typeinfo(ale_setting);
00402         
00403         if (acf == NULL) {
00404             printf("ERROR: no channel info for the changed channel\n");
00405             return;
00406         }
00407         
00408         /* get the level of the channel that was affected
00409          *   - we define the level as simply being the offset for the start of the channel
00410          */
00411         matchLevel= (acf->get_offset)? acf->get_offset(ac, ale_setting) : 0;
00412         prevLevel= matchLevel;
00413     }
00414     
00415     /* flush up? 
00416      *
00417      * For Visibility:
00418      *  - only flush up if the current state is now enabled (positive 'on' state is default) 
00419      *    (otherwise, it's too much work to force the parents to be inactive too)
00420      *
00421      * For everything else:
00422      *  - only flush up if the current state is now disabled (negative 'off' state is default)
00423      *    (otherwise, it's too much work to force the parents to be active too)
00424      */
00425     if ( ((setting == ACHANNEL_SETTING_VISIBLE) && on) ||
00426          ((setting != ACHANNEL_SETTING_VISIBLE) && on==0) )
00427     {
00428         /* go backwards in the list, until the highest-ranking element (by indention has been covered) */
00429         for (ale= match->prev; ale; ale= ale->prev) {
00430             bAnimChannelType *acf= ANIM_channel_get_typeinfo(ale);
00431             int level;
00432             
00433             /* if no channel info was found, skip, since this type might not have any useful info */
00434             if (acf == NULL)
00435                 continue;
00436             
00437             /* get the level of the current channel traversed 
00438              *   - we define the level as simply being the offset for the start of the channel
00439              */
00440             level= (acf->get_offset)? acf->get_offset(ac, ale) : 0;
00441             
00442             /* if the level is 'less than' (i.e. more important) the level we're matching
00443              * but also 'less than' the level just tried (i.e. only the 1st group above grouped F-Curves, 
00444              * when toggling visibility of F-Curves, gets flushed, which should happen if we don't let prevLevel
00445              * get updated below once the first 1st group is found)...
00446              */
00447             if (level < prevLevel) {
00448                 /* flush the new status... */
00449                 ANIM_channel_setting_set(ac, ale, setting, on);
00450                 
00451                 /* store this level as the 'old' level now */
00452                 prevLevel= level;
00453             }   
00454             /* if the level is 'greater than' (i.e. less important) than the previous level... */
00455             else if (level > prevLevel) {
00456                 /* if previous level was a base-level (i.e. 0 offset / root of one hierarchy),
00457                  * stop here
00458                  */
00459                 if (prevLevel == 0)
00460                     break;
00461                 /* otherwise, this level weaves into another sibling hierarchy to the previous one just
00462                  * finished, so skip until we get to the parent of this level 
00463                  */
00464                 else
00465                     continue;
00466             }
00467         }
00468     }
00469     
00470     /* flush down (always) */
00471     {
00472         /* go forwards in the list, until the lowest-ranking element (by indention has been covered) */
00473         for (ale= match->next; ale; ale= ale->next) {
00474             bAnimChannelType *acf= ANIM_channel_get_typeinfo(ale);
00475             int level;
00476             
00477             /* if no channel info was found, skip, since this type might not have any useful info */
00478             if (acf == NULL)
00479                 continue;
00480             
00481             /* get the level of the current channel traversed 
00482              *   - we define the level as simply being the offset for the start of the channel
00483              */
00484             level= (acf->get_offset)? acf->get_offset(ac, ale) : 0;
00485             
00486             /* if the level is 'greater than' (i.e. less important) the channel that was changed, 
00487              * flush the new status...
00488              */
00489             if (level > matchLevel)
00490                 ANIM_channel_setting_set(ac, ale, setting, on);
00491             /* however, if the level is 'less than or equal to' the channel that was changed,
00492              * (i.e. the current channel is as important if not more important than the changed channel)
00493              * then we should stop, since we've found the last one of the children we should flush
00494              */
00495             else
00496                 break;
00497             
00498             /* store this level as the 'old' level now */
00499             // prevLevel= level; // XXX: prevLevel is unused
00500         }
00501     }
00502 }
00503 
00504 /* -------------------------- F-Curves ------------------------------------- */
00505 
00506 /* Delete the given F-Curve from its AnimData block */
00507 void ANIM_fcurve_delete_from_animdata (bAnimContext *ac, AnimData *adt, FCurve *fcu)
00508 {
00509     /* - if no AnimData, we've got nowhere to remove the F-Curve from 
00510      *  (this doesn't guarantee that the F-Curve is in there, but at least we tried
00511      * - if no F-Curve, there is nothing to remove
00512      */
00513     if (ELEM(NULL, adt, fcu))
00514         return;
00515         
00516     /* remove from whatever list it came from
00517      *  - Action Group
00518      *  - Action
00519      *  - Drivers
00520      *  - TODO... some others?
00521      */
00522     if ((ac) && (ac->datatype == ANIMCONT_DRIVERS)) {
00523         /* driver F-Curve */
00524         BLI_remlink(&adt->drivers, fcu);
00525     }
00526     else if (adt->action) {
00527         /* remove from group or action, whichever one "owns" the F-Curve */
00528         if (fcu->grp)
00529             action_groups_remove_channel(adt->action, fcu);
00530         else
00531             BLI_remlink(&adt->action->curves, fcu);
00532             
00533         /* if action has no more F-Curves as a result of this, unlink it from
00534          * AnimData if it did not come from a NLA Strip being tweaked.
00535          *
00536          * This is done so that we don't have dangling Object+Action entries in
00537          * channel list that are empty, and linger around long after the data they
00538          * are for has disappeared (and probably won't come back).
00539          */
00540             // XXX: does everybody always want this?
00541             /* XXX: there's a problem where many actions could build up in the file if multiple
00542              * full add/delete cycles are performed on the same objects, but assume that this is rare
00543              */
00544         if ((adt->action->curves.first == NULL) && (adt->flag & ADT_NLA_EDIT_ON)==0) {
00545             id_us_min(&adt->action->id);
00546             adt->action = NULL;
00547         }
00548     }
00549         
00550     /* free the F-Curve itself */
00551     free_fcurve(fcu);
00552 }

00559 /* poll callback for being in an Animation Editor channels list region */
00560 static int animedit_poll_channels_active (bContext *C)
00561 {
00562     ScrArea *sa= CTX_wm_area(C);
00563     
00564     /* channels region test */
00565     // TODO: could enhance with actually testing if channels region?
00566     if (ELEM(NULL, sa, CTX_wm_region(C)))
00567         return 0;
00568     /* animation editor test */
00569     if (ELEM3(sa->spacetype, SPACE_ACTION, SPACE_IPO, SPACE_NLA) == 0)
00570         return 0;
00571         
00572     return 1;
00573 }
00574 
00575 /* poll callback for Animation Editor channels list region + not in NLA-tweakmode for NLA */
00576 static int animedit_poll_channels_nla_tweakmode_off (bContext *C)
00577 {
00578     ScrArea *sa= CTX_wm_area(C);
00579     Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00580     
00581     /* channels region test */
00582     // TODO: could enhance with actually testing if channels region?
00583     if (ELEM(NULL, sa, CTX_wm_region(C)))
00584         return 0;
00585     /* animation editor test */
00586     if (ELEM3(sa->spacetype, SPACE_ACTION, SPACE_IPO, SPACE_NLA) == 0)
00587         return 0;
00588     
00589     /* NLA TweakMode test */    
00590     if (sa->spacetype == SPACE_NLA) {
00591         if ((scene == NULL) || (scene->flag & SCE_NLA_EDIT_ON))
00592             return 0;
00593     }
00594         
00595     return 1;
00596 }

00598 /* ****************** Rearrange Channels Operator ******************* */
00599 
00600 /* constants for channel rearranging */
00601 /* WARNING: don't change exising ones without modifying rearrange func accordingly */
00602 enum {
00603     REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_TOP= -2,
00604     REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_UP= -1,
00605     REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_DOWN= 1,
00606     REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_BOTTOM= 2
00607 };
00608 
00609 /* defines for rearranging channels */
00610 static EnumPropertyItem prop_animchannel_rearrange_types[] = {
00611     {REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_TOP, "TOP", 0, "To Top", ""},
00612     {REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_UP, "UP", 0, "Up", ""},
00613     {REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_DOWN, "DOWN", 0, "Down", ""},
00614     {REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_BOTTOM, "BOTTOM", 0, "To Bottom", ""},
00615     {0, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL}
00616 };
00617 
00618 /* Reordering "Islands" Defines ----------------------------------- */
00619 
00620 /* Island definition - just a listbase container */
00621 typedef struct tReorderChannelIsland {
00622     struct tReorderChannelIsland *next, *prev;
00623     
00624     ListBase channels;  /* channels within this region with the same state */
00625     int flag;           /* eReorderIslandFlag */
00626 } tReorderChannelIsland;
00627 
00628 /* flags for channel reordering islands */
00629 typedef enum eReorderIslandFlag {
00630     REORDER_ISLAND_SELECTED         = (1<<0),   /* island is selected */
00631     REORDER_ISLAND_UNTOUCHABLE      = (1<<1),   /* island should be ignored */
00632     REORDER_ISLAND_MOVED            = (1<<2)    /* island has already been moved */
00633 } eReorderIslandFlag;
00634 
00635 
00636 /* Rearrange Methods --------------------------------------------- */
00637 
00638 static short rearrange_island_ok (tReorderChannelIsland *island)
00639 {
00640     /* island must not be untouchable */
00641     if (island->flag & REORDER_ISLAND_UNTOUCHABLE)
00642         return 0;
00643     
00644     /* island should be selected to be moved */
00645     return (island->flag & REORDER_ISLAND_SELECTED) && !(island->flag & REORDER_ISLAND_MOVED);
00646 }
00647 
00648 /* ............................. */
00649 
00650 static short rearrange_island_top (ListBase *list, tReorderChannelIsland *island)
00651 {
00652     if (rearrange_island_ok(island)) {
00653         /* remove from current position */
00654         BLI_remlink(list, island);
00655         
00656         /* make it first element */
00657         BLI_insertlinkbefore(list, list->first, island);
00658         
00659         return 1;
00660     }
00661     
00662     return 0;
00663 }
00664 
00665 static short rearrange_island_up (ListBase *list, tReorderChannelIsland *island)
00666 {
00667     if (rearrange_island_ok(island)) {
00668         /* moving up = moving before the previous island, otherwise we're in the same place */
00669         tReorderChannelIsland *prev= island->prev;
00670         
00671         if (prev) {
00672             /* remove from current position */
00673             BLI_remlink(list, island);
00674             
00675             /* push it up */
00676             BLI_insertlinkbefore(list, prev, island);
00677             
00678             return 1;
00679         }
00680     }
00681     
00682     return 0;
00683 }
00684 
00685 static short rearrange_island_down (ListBase *list, tReorderChannelIsland *island)
00686 {
00687     if (rearrange_island_ok(island)) {
00688         /* moving down = moving after the next island, otherwise we're in the same place */
00689         tReorderChannelIsland *next = island->next;
00690         
00691         if (next) {
00692             /* can only move past if next is not untouchable (i.e. nothing can go after it) */
00693             if ((next->flag & REORDER_ISLAND_UNTOUCHABLE)==0) {
00694                 /* remove from current position */
00695                 BLI_remlink(list, island);
00696                 
00697                 /* push it down */
00698                 BLI_insertlinkafter(list, next, island);
00699                 
00700                 return 1;
00701             }
00702         }
00703         /* else: no next channel, so we're at the bottom already, so can't move */
00704     }
00705     
00706     return 0;
00707 }
00708 
00709 static short rearrange_island_bottom (ListBase *list, tReorderChannelIsland *island)
00710 {
00711     if (rearrange_island_ok(island)) {
00712         tReorderChannelIsland *last = list->last;
00713         
00714         /* remove island from current position */
00715         BLI_remlink(list, island);
00716         
00717         /* add before or after the last channel? */
00718         if ((last->flag & REORDER_ISLAND_UNTOUCHABLE)==0) {
00719             /* can add after it */
00720             BLI_addtail(list, island);
00721         }
00722         else {
00723             /* can at most go just before it, since last cannot be moved */
00724             BLI_insertlinkbefore(list, last, island);
00725             
00726         }
00727         
00728         return 1;
00729     }
00730     
00731     return 0;
00732 }
00733 
00734 /* ............................. */
00735 
00736 /* typedef for channel rearranging function 
00737  * < list: list that channels belong to
00738  * < island: island to be moved
00739  * > return[0]: whether operation was a success
00740  */
00741 typedef short (*AnimChanRearrangeFp)(ListBase *list, tReorderChannelIsland *island);
00742 
00743 /* get rearranging function, given 'rearrange' mode */
00744 static AnimChanRearrangeFp rearrange_get_mode_func (short mode)
00745 {
00746     switch (mode) {
00747         case REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_TOP:
00748             return rearrange_island_top;
00749         case REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_UP:
00750             return rearrange_island_up;
00751         case REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_DOWN:
00752             return rearrange_island_down;
00753         case REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_BOTTOM:
00754             return rearrange_island_bottom;
00755         default:
00756             return NULL;
00757     }
00758 }
00759 
00760 /* Rearrange Islands Generics ------------------------------------- */
00761 
00762 /* add channel into list of islands */
00763 static void rearrange_animchannel_add_to_islands (ListBase *islands, ListBase *srcList, Link *channel, short type)
00764 {
00765     tReorderChannelIsland *island = islands->last;  /* always try to add to last island if possible */
00766     short is_sel=0, is_untouchable=0;
00767     
00768     /* get flags - selected and untouchable from the channel */
00769     switch (type) {
00770         case ANIMTYPE_GROUP:
00771         {
00772             bActionGroup *agrp= (bActionGroup *)channel;
00773             
00774             is_sel= SEL_AGRP(agrp);
00775             is_untouchable= (agrp->flag & AGRP_TEMP) != 0;
00776         }
00777             break;
00778         case ANIMTYPE_FCURVE:
00779         {
00780             FCurve *fcu= (FCurve *)channel;
00781             
00782             is_sel= SEL_FCU(fcu);
00783         }   
00784             break;
00785         case ANIMTYPE_NLATRACK:
00786         {
00787             NlaTrack *nlt= (NlaTrack *)channel;
00788             
00789             is_sel= SEL_NLT(nlt);
00790         }
00791             break;
00792             
00793         default:
00794             printf("rearrange_animchannel_add_to_islands(): don't know how to handle channels of type %d\n", type);
00795             return;
00796     }
00797     
00798     /* do we need to add to a new island? */
00799     if ((island == NULL) ||                                 /* 1) no islands yet */
00800         ((island->flag & REORDER_ISLAND_SELECTED) == 0) ||  /* 2) unselected islands have single channels only - to allow up/down movement */
00801         (is_sel == 0))                                      /* 3) if channel is unselected, stop existing island (it was either wrong sel status, or full already) */
00802     {
00803         /* create a new island now */
00804         island = MEM_callocN(sizeof(tReorderChannelIsland), "tReorderChannelIsland");
00805         BLI_addtail(islands, island);
00806         
00807         if (is_sel)
00808             island->flag |= REORDER_ISLAND_SELECTED;
00809         if (is_untouchable)
00810             island->flag |= REORDER_ISLAND_UNTOUCHABLE;
00811     }
00812 
00813     /* add channel to island - need to remove it from its existing list first though */
00814     BLI_remlink(srcList, channel);
00815     BLI_addtail(&island->channels, channel);
00816 }
00817 
00818 /* flatten islands out into a single list again */
00819 static void rearrange_animchannel_flatten_islands (ListBase *islands, ListBase *srcList)
00820 {
00821     tReorderChannelIsland *island, *isn=NULL;
00822     
00823     /* make sure srcList is empty now */
00824     BLI_assert(srcList->first == NULL);
00825     
00826     /* go through merging islands */
00827     for (island = islands->first; island; island = isn) {
00828         isn = island->next;
00829         
00830         /* merge island channels back to main list, then delete the island */
00831         BLI_movelisttolist(srcList, &island->channels);
00832         BLI_freelinkN(islands, island);
00833     }
00834 }
00835 
00836 /* ............................. */
00837 
00838 /* performing rearranging of channels using islands */
00839 static short rearrange_animchannel_islands (ListBase *list, AnimChanRearrangeFp rearrange_func, short mode, short type)
00840 {
00841     ListBase islands = {NULL, NULL};
00842     Link *channel, *chanNext=NULL;
00843     short done = 0;
00844     
00845     /* don't waste effort on an empty list */
00846     if (list->first == NULL)
00847         return 0;
00848     
00849     /* group channels into islands */
00850     for (channel = list->first; channel; channel = chanNext) {
00851         chanNext = channel->next;
00852         rearrange_animchannel_add_to_islands(&islands, list, channel, type);
00853     }
00854     
00855     /* perform moving of selected islands now, but only if there is more than one of 'em so that something will happen 
00856      *  - scanning of the list is performed in the opposite direction to the direction we're moving things, so that we 
00857      *    shouldn't need to encounter items we've moved already
00858      */
00859     if (islands.first != islands.last) {
00860         tReorderChannelIsland *first = (mode > 0) ? islands.last : islands.first;
00861         tReorderChannelIsland *island, *isn=NULL;
00862         
00863         for (island = first; island; island = isn) {
00864             isn = (mode > 0) ? island->prev : island->next;
00865             
00866             /* perform rearranging */
00867             if (rearrange_func(&islands, island)) {
00868                 island->flag |= REORDER_ISLAND_MOVED;
00869                 done = 1;
00870             }
00871         }
00872     }
00873     
00874     /* ungroup islands */
00875     rearrange_animchannel_flatten_islands(&islands, list);
00876     
00877     /* did we do anything? */
00878     return done;
00879 }
00880 
00881 /* NLA Specific Stuff ----------------------------------------------------- */
00882 
00883 /* Change the order NLA Tracks within NLA Stack
00884  * ! NLA tracks are displayed in opposite order, so directions need care
00885  *  mode: REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_*  
00886  */
00887 static void rearrange_nla_channels (bAnimContext *UNUSED(ac), AnimData *adt, short mode)
00888 {
00889     AnimChanRearrangeFp rearrange_func;
00890     
00891     /* hack: invert mode so that functions will work in right order */
00892     mode *= -1;
00893     
00894     /* get rearranging function */
00895     rearrange_func = rearrange_get_mode_func(mode);
00896     if (rearrange_func == NULL)
00897         return;
00898     
00899     /* only consider NLA data if it's accessible */ 
00900     //if (EXPANDED_DRVD(adt) == 0)
00901     //  return;
00902     
00903     /* perform rearranging on tracks list */
00904     rearrange_animchannel_islands(&adt->nla_tracks, rearrange_func, mode, ANIMTYPE_NLATRACK);
00905 }
00906 
00907 /* Drivers Specific Stuff ------------------------------------------------- */
00908 
00909 /* Change the order drivers within AnimData block
00910  *  mode: REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_*  
00911  */
00912 static void rearrange_driver_channels (bAnimContext *UNUSED(ac), AnimData *adt, short mode)
00913 {
00914     /* get rearranging function */
00915     AnimChanRearrangeFp rearrange_func = rearrange_get_mode_func(mode);
00916     
00917     if (rearrange_func == NULL)
00918         return;
00919     
00920     /* only consider drivers if they're accessible */   
00921     if (EXPANDED_DRVD(adt) == 0)
00922         return;
00923     
00924     /* perform rearranging on drivers list (drivers are really just F-Curves) */
00925     rearrange_animchannel_islands(&adt->drivers, rearrange_func, mode, ANIMTYPE_FCURVE);
00926 }
00927 
00928 /* Action Specific Stuff ------------------------------------------------- */
00929 
00930 /* make sure all action-channels belong to a group (and clear action's list) */
00931 static void split_groups_action_temp (bAction *act, bActionGroup *tgrp)
00932 {
00933     bActionGroup *agrp;
00934     FCurve *fcu;
00935     
00936     if (act == NULL)
00937         return;
00938     
00939     /* Separate F-Curves into lists per group */
00940     for (agrp= act->groups.first; agrp; agrp= agrp->next) {
00941         if (agrp->channels.first) {
00942             fcu= agrp->channels.last;
00943             act->curves.first= fcu->next;
00944             
00945             fcu= agrp->channels.first;
00946             fcu->prev= NULL;
00947             
00948             fcu= agrp->channels.last;
00949             fcu->next= NULL;
00950         }
00951     }
00952     
00953     /* Initialize memory for temp-group */
00954     memset(tgrp, 0, sizeof(bActionGroup));
00955     tgrp->flag |= (AGRP_EXPANDED|AGRP_TEMP);
00956     BLI_strncpy(tgrp->name, "#TempGroup", sizeof(tgrp->name));
00957     
00958     /* Move any action-channels not already moved, to the temp group */
00959     if (act->curves.first) {
00960         /* start of list */
00961         fcu= act->curves.first;
00962         fcu->prev= NULL;
00963         tgrp->channels.first= fcu;
00964         act->curves.first= NULL;
00965         
00966         /* end of list */
00967         fcu= act->curves.last;
00968         fcu->next= NULL;
00969         tgrp->channels.last= fcu;
00970         act->curves.last= NULL;
00971     }
00972     
00973     /* Add temp-group to list */
00974     BLI_addtail(&act->groups, tgrp);
00975 }
00976 
00977 /* link lists of channels that groups have */
00978 static void join_groups_action_temp (bAction *act)
00979 {
00980     bActionGroup *agrp;
00981     
00982     for (agrp= act->groups.first; agrp; agrp= agrp->next) {
00983         ListBase tempGroup;
00984         
00985         /* add list of channels to action's channels */
00986         tempGroup= agrp->channels;
00987         BLI_movelisttolist(&act->curves, &agrp->channels);
00988         agrp->channels= tempGroup;
00989         
00990         /* clear moved flag */
00991         agrp->flag &= ~AGRP_MOVED;
00992         
00993         /* if temp-group... remove from list (but don't free as it's on the stack!) */
00994         if (agrp->flag & AGRP_TEMP) {
00995             BLI_remlink(&act->groups, agrp);
00996             break;
00997         }
00998     }
00999 }
01000 
01001 /* Change the order of anim-channels within action 
01002  *  mode: REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_*  
01003  */
01004 static void rearrange_action_channels (bAnimContext *ac, bAction *act, short mode)
01005 {
01006     bActionGroup tgrp;
01007     short do_channels;
01008     
01009     /* get rearranging function */
01010     AnimChanRearrangeFp rearrange_func = rearrange_get_mode_func(mode);
01011     
01012     if (rearrange_func == NULL)
01013         return;
01014     
01015     /* make sure we're only operating with groups (vs a mixture of groups+curves) */
01016     split_groups_action_temp(act, &tgrp);
01017     
01018     /* rearrange groups first 
01019      *  - the group's channels will only get considered if nothing happened when rearranging the groups
01020      *    i.e. the rearrange function returned 0
01021      */
01022     do_channels = rearrange_animchannel_islands(&act->groups, rearrange_func, mode, ANIMTYPE_GROUP) == 0;
01023     
01024     if (do_channels) {
01025         bActionGroup *agrp;
01026         
01027         for (agrp= act->groups.first; agrp; agrp= agrp->next) {
01028             /* only consider F-Curves if they're visible (group expanded) */
01029             if (EXPANDED_AGRP(ac, agrp)) {
01030                 rearrange_animchannel_islands(&agrp->channels, rearrange_func, mode, ANIMTYPE_FCURVE);
01031             }
01032         }
01033     }
01034     
01035     /* assemble lists into one list (and clear moved tags) */
01036     join_groups_action_temp(act);
01037 }
01038 
01039 /* ------------------- */
01040 
01041 static int animchannels_rearrange_exec(bContext *C, wmOperator *op)
01042 {
01043     bAnimContext ac;
01044     short mode;
01045     
01046     /* get editor data */
01047     if (ANIM_animdata_get_context(C, &ac) == 0)
01048         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
01049         
01050     /* get mode */
01051     mode= RNA_enum_get(op->ptr, "direction");
01052     
01053     /* method to move channels depends on the editor */
01054     if (ac.datatype == ANIMCONT_GPENCIL) {
01055         /* Grease Pencil channels */
01056         printf("Grease Pencil not supported for moving yet\n");
01057     }
01058     else if (ac.datatype == ANIMCONT_ACTION) {
01059         /* Directly rearrange action's channels */
01060         rearrange_action_channels(&ac, ac.data, mode);
01061     }
01062     else {
01063         ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
01064         bAnimListElem *ale;
01065         int filter;
01066         
01067         /* get animdata blocks */
01068         filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_ANIMDATA);
01069         ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &anim_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
01070         
01071         for (ale = anim_data.first; ale; ale = ale->next) {
01072             AnimData *adt= ale->data;
01073             
01074             switch (ac.datatype) {
01075                 case ANIMCONT_NLA: /* NLA-tracks only */
01076                     rearrange_nla_channels(&ac, adt, mode);
01077                     break;
01078                 
01079                 case ANIMCONT_DRIVERS: /* Drivers list only */
01080                     rearrange_driver_channels(&ac, adt, mode);
01081                     break;
01082                 
01083                 case ANIMCONT_SHAPEKEY: // DOUBLE CHECK ME...
01084                     
01085                 default: /* some collection of actions */
01086                     if (adt->action)
01087                         rearrange_action_channels(&ac, adt->action, mode);
01088                     else if (G.debug & G_DEBUG)
01089                         printf("Animdata has no action\n");
01090                     break;
01091             }
01092         }
01093         
01094         /* free temp data */
01095         BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
01096     }
01097     
01098     /* send notifier that things have changed */
01099     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_ANIMATION|ND_ANIMCHAN|NA_EDITED, NULL);
01100     
01101     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
01102 }
01103 
01104 static void ANIM_OT_channels_move (wmOperatorType *ot)
01105 {
01106     /* identifiers */
01107     ot->name = "Move Channels";
01108     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_channels_move";
01109     ot->description = "Rearrange selected animation channels";
01110     
01111     /* api callbacks */
01112     ot->exec = animchannels_rearrange_exec;
01113     ot->poll = animedit_poll_channels_nla_tweakmode_off;
01114     
01115     /* flags */
01116     ot->flag = OPTYPE_REGISTER|OPTYPE_UNDO;
01117     
01118     /* props */
01119     ot->prop = RNA_def_enum(ot->srna, "direction", prop_animchannel_rearrange_types, REARRANGE_ANIMCHAN_DOWN, "Direction", "");
01120 }
01121 
01122 /* ******************** Delete Channel Operator *********************** */
01123 
01124 static int animchannels_delete_exec(bContext *C, wmOperator *UNUSED(op))
01125 {
01126     bAnimContext ac;
01127     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
01128     bAnimListElem *ale;
01129     int filter;
01130     
01131     /* get editor data */
01132     if (ANIM_animdata_get_context(C, &ac) == 0)
01133         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
01134     
01135     /* cannot delete in shapekey */
01136     if (ac.datatype == ANIMCONT_SHAPEKEY) 
01137         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
01138         
01139         
01140     /* do groups only first (unless in Drivers mode, where there are none) */
01141     if (ac.datatype != ANIMCONT_DRIVERS) {
01142         /* filter data */
01143         filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_SEL | ANIMFILTER_LIST_CHANNELS | ANIMFILTER_FOREDIT | ANIMFILTER_NODUPLIS);
01144         ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &anim_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
01145         
01146         /* delete selected groups and their associated channels */
01147         for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
01148             /* only groups - don't check other types yet, since they may no-longer exist */
01149             if (ale->type == ANIMTYPE_GROUP) {
01150                 bActionGroup *agrp= (bActionGroup *)ale->data;
01151                 AnimData *adt= ale->adt;
01152                 FCurve *fcu, *fcn;
01153                 
01154                 /* skip this group if no AnimData available, as we can't safely remove the F-Curves */
01155                 if (adt == NULL)
01156                     continue;
01157                 
01158                 /* delete all of the Group's F-Curves, but no others */
01159                 for (fcu= agrp->channels.first; fcu && fcu->grp==agrp; fcu= fcn) {
01160                     fcn= fcu->next;
01161                     
01162                     /* remove from group and action, then free */
01163                     action_groups_remove_channel(adt->action, fcu);
01164                     free_fcurve(fcu);
01165                 }
01166                 
01167                 /* free the group itself */
01168                 if (adt->action)
01169                     BLI_freelinkN(&adt->action->groups, agrp);
01170                 else
01171                     MEM_freeN(agrp);
01172             }
01173         }
01174         
01175         /* cleanup */
01176         BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
01177     }
01178     
01179     /* filter data */
01180     filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_SEL | ANIMFILTER_FOREDIT | ANIMFILTER_NODUPLIS);
01181     ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &anim_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
01182     
01183     /* delete selected data channels */
01184     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
01185         switch (ale->type) {
01186             case ANIMTYPE_FCURVE: 
01187             {
01188                 /* F-Curves if we can identify its parent */
01189                 AnimData *adt= ale->adt;
01190                 FCurve *fcu= (FCurve *)ale->data;
01191                 
01192                 /* try to free F-Curve */
01193                 ANIM_fcurve_delete_from_animdata(&ac, adt, fcu);
01194             }
01195                 break;
01196                 
01197             case ANIMTYPE_GPLAYER:
01198             {
01199                 /* Grease Pencil layer */
01200                 bGPdata *gpd= (bGPdata *)ale->id;
01201                 bGPDlayer *gpl= (bGPDlayer *)ale->data;
01202                 
01203                 /* try to delete the layer's data and the layer itself */
01204                 free_gpencil_frames(gpl);
01205                 BLI_freelinkN(&gpd->layers, gpl);
01206             }
01207                 break;
01208         }
01209     }
01210     
01211     /* cleanup */
01212     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
01213     
01214     /* send notifier that things have changed */
01215     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_ANIMATION|ND_ANIMCHAN|NA_EDITED, NULL);
01216     
01217     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
01218 }
01219  
01220 static void ANIM_OT_channels_delete (wmOperatorType *ot)
01221 {
01222     /* identifiers */
01223     ot->name = "Delete Channels";
01224     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_channels_delete";
01225     ot->description = "Delete all selected animation channels";
01226     
01227     /* api callbacks */
01228     ot->exec = animchannels_delete_exec;
01229     ot->poll = animedit_poll_channels_active;
01230     
01231     /* flags */
01232     ot->flag = OPTYPE_REGISTER|OPTYPE_UNDO;
01233 }
01234 
01235 /* ******************** Set Channel Visibility Operator *********************** */
01236 /* NOTE: this operator is only valid in the Graph Editor channels region */
01237 
01238 static int animchannels_visibility_set_exec(bContext *C, wmOperator *UNUSED(op))
01239 {
01240     bAnimContext ac;
01241     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
01242     ListBase all_data = {NULL, NULL};
01243     bAnimListElem *ale;
01244     int filter;
01245     
01246     /* get editor data */
01247     if (ANIM_animdata_get_context(C, &ac) == 0)
01248         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
01249     
01250     /* get list of all channels that selection may need to be flushed to 
01251      * - hierarchy mustn't affect what we have access to here...
01252      */
01253     filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_CHANNELS | ANIMFILTER_NODUPLIS);
01254     ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &all_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
01255         
01256     /* hide all channels not selected
01257      * - hierarchy matters if we're doing this from the channels region
01258      *   since we only want to apply this to channels we can "see", 
01259      *   and have these affect their relatives
01260      * - but for Graph Editor, this gets used also from main region
01261      *   where hierarchy doesn't apply, as for [#21276]
01262      */
01263     if ((ac.spacetype == SPACE_IPO) && (ac.regiontype != RGN_TYPE_CHANNELS)) {
01264         /* graph editor (case 2) */
01265         filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_UNSEL | ANIMFILTER_CURVE_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_NODUPLIS);
01266     }
01267     else {
01268         /* standard case */
01269         filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_UNSEL | ANIMFILTER_NODUPLIS);
01270     }
01271     ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &anim_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
01272     
01273     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
01274         /* clear setting first */
01275         ANIM_channel_setting_set(&ac, ale, ACHANNEL_SETTING_VISIBLE, ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR);
01276         
01277         /* now also flush selection status as appropriate 
01278          * NOTE: in some cases, this may result in repeat flushing being performed
01279          */
01280         ANIM_flush_setting_anim_channels(&ac, &all_data, ale, ACHANNEL_SETTING_VISIBLE, 0);
01281     }
01282     
01283     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
01284     
01285     /* make all the selected channels visible */
01286     filter= (ANIMFILTER_SEL | ANIMFILTER_NODUPLIS);
01287     ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &anim_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
01288     
01289     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
01290         /* hack: skip object channels for now, since flushing those will always flush everything, but they are always included */
01291         // TODO: find out why this is the case, and fix that
01292         if (ale->type == ANIMTYPE_OBJECT)
01293             continue;
01294         
01295         /* enable the setting */
01296         ANIM_channel_setting_set(&ac, ale, ACHANNEL_SETTING_VISIBLE, ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_ADD);
01297         
01298         /* now, also flush selection status up/down as appropriate */
01299         ANIM_flush_setting_anim_channels(&ac, &all_data, ale, ACHANNEL_SETTING_VISIBLE, 1);
01300     }
01301     
01302     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
01303     BLI_freelistN(&all_data);
01304     
01305     
01306     /* send notifier that things have changed */
01307     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_ANIMATION|ND_ANIMCHAN|NA_EDITED, NULL);
01308     
01309     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
01310 }
01311 
01312 static void ANIM_OT_channels_visibility_set (wmOperatorType *ot)
01313 {
01314     /* identifiers */
01315     ot->name = "Set Visibility";
01316     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_channels_visibility_set";
01317     ot->description = "Make only the selected animation channels visible in the Graph Editor";
01318     
01319     /* api callbacks */
01320     ot->exec = animchannels_visibility_set_exec;
01321     ot->poll = ED_operator_graphedit_active;
01322     
01323     /* flags */
01324     ot->flag = OPTYPE_REGISTER|OPTYPE_UNDO;
01325 }
01326 
01327 
01328 /* ******************** Toggle Channel Visibility Operator *********************** */
01329 /* NOTE: this operator is only valid in the Graph Editor channels region */
01330 
01331 static int animchannels_visibility_toggle_exec(bContext *C, wmOperator *UNUSED(op))
01332 {
01333     bAnimContext ac;
01334     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
01335     ListBase all_data = {NULL, NULL};
01336     bAnimListElem *ale;
01337     int filter;
01338     short vis= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_ADD;
01339     
01340     /* get editor data */
01341     if (ANIM_animdata_get_context(C, &ac) == 0)
01342         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
01343         
01344     /* get list of all channels that selection may need to be flushed to 
01345      * - hierarchy mustn't affect what we have access to here...
01346      */
01347     filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_CHANNELS | ANIMFILTER_NODUPLIS);
01348     ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &all_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
01349         
01350     /* filter data
01351      * - restrict this to only applying on settings we can get to in the list
01352      */
01353     filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_SEL | ANIMFILTER_NODUPLIS);
01354     ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &anim_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
01355     
01356     /* See if we should be making showing all selected or hiding */
01357     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
01358         /* set the setting in the appropriate way (if available) */
01359         if (ANIM_channel_setting_get(&ac, ale, ACHANNEL_SETTING_VISIBLE)) {
01360             vis= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR;
01361             break;
01362         }
01363     }
01364 
01365     /* Now set the flags */
01366     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
01367         /* hack: skip object channels for now, since flushing those will always flush everything, but they are always included */
01368         // TODO: find out why this is the case, and fix that
01369         if (ale->type == ANIMTYPE_OBJECT)
01370             continue;
01371         
01372         /* change the setting */
01373         ANIM_channel_setting_set(&ac, ale, ACHANNEL_SETTING_VISIBLE, vis);
01374         
01375         /* now, also flush selection status up/down as appropriate */
01376         ANIM_flush_setting_anim_channels(&ac, &all_data, ale, ACHANNEL_SETTING_VISIBLE, (vis == ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_ADD));
01377     }
01378     
01379     /* cleanup */
01380     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
01381     BLI_freelistN(&all_data);
01382     
01383     /* send notifier that things have changed */
01384     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_ANIMATION|ND_ANIMCHAN|NA_EDITED, NULL);
01385     
01386     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
01387 }
01388 
01389 static void ANIM_OT_channels_visibility_toggle (wmOperatorType *ot)
01390 {
01391     /* identifiers */
01392     ot->name = "Toggle Visibility";
01393     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_channels_visibility_toggle";
01394     ot->description = "Toggle visibility in Graph Editor of all selected animation channels";
01395     
01396     /* api callbacks */
01397     ot->exec = animchannels_visibility_toggle_exec;
01398     ot->poll = ED_operator_graphedit_active;
01399     
01400     /* flags */
01401     ot->flag = OPTYPE_REGISTER|OPTYPE_UNDO;
01402 }
01403 
01404 /* ********************** Set Flags Operator *********************** */
01405 
01406 /* defines for setting animation-channel flags */
01407 static EnumPropertyItem prop_animchannel_setflag_types[] = {
01408     {ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_TOGGLE, "TOGGLE", 0, "Toggle", ""},
01409     {ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR, "DISABLE", 0, "Disable", ""},
01410     {ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_ADD, "ENABLE", 0, "Enable", ""},
01411     {ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_INVERT, "INVERT", 0, "Invert", ""},
01412     {0, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL}
01413 };
01414 
01415 /* defines for set animation-channel settings */
01416 // TODO: could add some more types, but those are really quite dependent on the mode...
01417 static EnumPropertyItem prop_animchannel_settings_types[] = {
01418     {ACHANNEL_SETTING_PROTECT, "PROTECT", 0, "Protect", ""},
01419     {ACHANNEL_SETTING_MUTE, "MUTE", 0, "Mute", ""},
01420     {0, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL}
01421 };
01422 
01423 
01424 /* ------------------- */
01425 
01426 /* Set/clear a particular flag (setting) for all selected + visible channels 
01427  *  setting: the setting to modify
01428  *  mode: eAnimChannels_SetFlag
01429  *  onlysel: only selected channels get the flag set
01430  */
01431 // TODO: enable a setting which turns flushing on/off?
01432 static void setflag_anim_channels (bAnimContext *ac, short setting, short mode, short onlysel, short flush)
01433 {
01434     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
01435     ListBase all_data = {NULL, NULL};
01436     bAnimListElem *ale;
01437     int filter;
01438     
01439     /* filter data that we need if flush is on */
01440     if (flush) {
01441         /* get list of all channels that selection may need to be flushed to 
01442          * - hierarchy visibility needs to be ignored so that settings can get flushed
01443          *   "down" inside closed containers
01444          */
01445         filter= ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_CHANNELS;
01446         ANIM_animdata_filter(ac, &all_data, filter, ac->data, ac->datatype);
01447     }
01448     
01449     /* filter data that we're working on 
01450      * - hierarchy matters if we're doing this from the channels region
01451      *   since we only want to apply this to channels we can "see", 
01452      *   and have these affect their relatives
01453      * - but for Graph Editor, this gets used also from main region
01454      *   where hierarchy doesn't apply [#21276]
01455      */
01456     if ((ac->spacetype == SPACE_IPO) && (ac->regiontype != RGN_TYPE_CHANNELS)) {
01457         /* graph editor (case 2) */
01458         filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_CHANNELS | ANIMFILTER_CURVE_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_NODUPLIS);
01459     }
01460     else {
01461         /* standard case */
01462         filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_CHANNELS | ANIMFILTER_NODUPLIS);
01463     }
01464     if (onlysel) filter |= ANIMFILTER_SEL;
01465     ANIM_animdata_filter(ac, &anim_data, filter, ac->data, ac->datatype);
01466     
01467     /* if toggling, check if disable or enable */
01468     if (mode == ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_TOGGLE) {
01469         /* default to turn all on, unless we encounter one that's on... */
01470         mode= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_ADD;
01471         
01472         /* see if we should turn off instead... */
01473         for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
01474             /* set the setting in the appropriate way (if available) */
01475             if (ANIM_channel_setting_get(ac, ale, setting) > 0) {
01476                 mode= ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_CLEAR;
01477                 break;
01478             }
01479         }
01480     }
01481     
01482     /* apply the setting */
01483     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
01484         /* skip channel if setting is not available */
01485         if (ANIM_channel_setting_get(ac, ale, setting) == -1)
01486             continue;
01487         
01488         /* set the setting in the appropriate way */
01489         ANIM_channel_setting_set(ac, ale, setting, mode);
01490         
01491         /* if flush status... */
01492         if (flush)
01493             ANIM_flush_setting_anim_channels(ac, &all_data, ale, setting, mode);
01494     }
01495     
01496     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
01497     BLI_freelistN(&all_data);
01498 }
01499 
01500 /* ------------------- */
01501 
01502 static int animchannels_setflag_exec(bContext *C, wmOperator *op)
01503 {
01504     bAnimContext ac;
01505     short mode, setting;
01506     short flush=1;
01507     
01508     /* get editor data */
01509     if (ANIM_animdata_get_context(C, &ac) == 0)
01510         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
01511         
01512     /* mode (eAnimChannels_SetFlag), setting (eAnimChannel_Settings) */
01513     mode= RNA_enum_get(op->ptr, "mode");
01514     setting= RNA_enum_get(op->ptr, "type");
01515     
01516     /* check if setting is flushable */
01517     if (setting == ACHANNEL_SETTING_EXPAND)
01518         flush= 0;
01519     
01520     /* modify setting 
01521      *  - only selected channels are affected
01522      */
01523     setflag_anim_channels(&ac, setting, mode, 1, flush);
01524     
01525     /* send notifier that things have changed */
01526     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_ANIMATION|ND_ANIMCHAN|NA_EDITED, NULL);
01527     
01528     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
01529 }
01530

01532 static void ANIM_OT_channels_setting_enable (wmOperatorType *ot)

01540     ot->invoke = WM_menu_invoke;
01541     ot->exec = animchannels_setflag_exec;
01542     ot->poll = animedit_poll_channels_active;
01543     
01544     /* flags */
01545     ot->flag = OPTYPE_REGISTER|OPTYPE_UNDO;
01546     
01547     /* props */

01550         /* setting to set */
01551     ot->prop = RNA_def_enum(ot->srna, "type", prop_animchannel_settings_types, 0, "Type", "");
01552 }

01619 /* ********************** Expand Channels Operator *********************** */
01620

01622 {
01623     bAnimContext ac;

01628         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
01629         
01630     /* only affect selected channels? */
01631     if (RNA_boolean_get(op->ptr, "all"))
01632         onlysel= 0;
01633     
01634     /* modify setting */
01635     setflag_anim_channels(&ac, ACHANNEL_SETTING_EXPAND, ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_ADD, onlysel, 0);
01636     
01637     /* send notifier that things have changed */
01638     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_ANIMATION|ND_ANIMCHAN|NA_EDITED, NULL);
01639     
01640     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
01641 }

01702 
01703 /* ******************* Reenable Disabled Operator ******************* */
01704 
01705 static int animchannels_enable_poll (bContext *C)
01706 {
01707     ScrArea *sa= CTX_wm_area(C);
01708     
01709     /* channels region test */
01710     // TODO: could enhance with actually testing if channels region?
01711     if (ELEM(NULL, sa, CTX_wm_region(C)))
01712         return 0;
01713         
01714     /* animation editor test - Action/Dopesheet/etc. and Graph only */
01715     if (ELEM(sa->spacetype, SPACE_ACTION, SPACE_IPO) == 0)
01716         return 0;
01717         
01718     return 1;
01719 }
01720 
01721 static int animchannels_enable_exec (bContext *C, wmOperator *UNUSED(op))
01722 {
01723     bAnimContext ac;
01724     
01725     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
01726     bAnimListElem *ale;
01727     int filter;
01728     
01729     /* get editor data */
01730     if (ANIM_animdata_get_context(C, &ac) == 0)
01731         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
01732     
01733     /* filter data */
01734     filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_NODUPLIS);
01735     ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &anim_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
01736     
01737     /* loop through filtered data and clean curves */
01738     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
01739         FCurve *fcu = (FCurve *)ale->data;
01740         
01741         /* remove disabled flags from F-Curves */
01742         fcu->flag &= ~FCURVE_DISABLED;
01743         
01744         /* for drivers, let's do the same too */
01745         if (fcu->driver)
01746             fcu->driver->flag &= ~DRIVER_FLAG_INVALID;
01747             
01748         /* tag everything for updates - in particular, this is needed to get drivers working again */
01749         ANIM_list_elem_update(ac.scene, ale);
01750     }
01751     
01752     /* free temp data */
01753     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
01754         
01755     /* send notifier that things have changed */
01756     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_ANIMATION|ND_ANIMCHAN|NA_EDITED, NULL);
01757     
01758     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
01759 }
01760 
01761 static void ANIM_OT_channels_fcurves_enable (wmOperatorType *ot)
01762 {
01763     /* identifiers */
01764     ot->name = "Revive Disabled F-Curves";
01765     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_channels_fcurves_enable";
01766     ot->description = "Clears 'disabled' tag from all F-Curves to get broken F-Curves working again";
01767     
01768     /* api callbacks */
01769     ot->exec = animchannels_enable_exec;
01770     ot->poll = animchannels_enable_poll;
01771     
01772     /* flags */
01773     ot->flag = OPTYPE_REGISTER|OPTYPE_UNDO;
01774 }
01775 
01776 /* ********************** Select All Operator *********************** */
01777 
01778 static int animchannels_deselectall_exec (bContext *C, wmOperator *op)
01779 {
01780     bAnimContext ac;
01781     
01782     /* get editor data */
01783     if (ANIM_animdata_get_context(C, &ac) == 0)
01784         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
01785         
01786     /* 'standard' behavior - check if selected, then apply relevant selection */
01787     if (RNA_boolean_get(op->ptr, "invert"))
01788         ANIM_deselect_anim_channels(&ac, ac.data, ac.datatype, 0, ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_TOGGLE);
01789     else
01790         ANIM_deselect_anim_channels(&ac, ac.data, ac.datatype, 1, ACHANNEL_SETFLAG_ADD);
01791     
01792     /* send notifier that things have changed */
01793     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_ANIMATION|ND_ANIMCHAN|NA_SELECTED, NULL);
01794     
01795     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
01796 }
